title: Design
content:
You should assign an HCMX license to the tenant to access the Design and Deploy functionality.

Design and Deploy(DND) bring in the capability to create a service design blueprint that can be subsequently ordered. Each service design includes service components created from component types or component templates that define what's automatically provisioned. You can use service designs to create a complex set of automated elements that support the consistency and repeatability of common manual tasks. These service designs then become the basis for service offerings, which support the IT Infrastructure Library (ITIL) and IT Service Management (ITSM) best practices.

Service design includes the following:

  • A hierarchy of service components. The hierarchy of service components, along with the Processing Order configured for each service component, defines the order of execution that occurs when the design is provisioned.
  • Resource offerings, which can be added to service components to enable the added resource offerings to be provisioned along with the service components.
  • Lifecycle actions, allow you to configure provisioning and de-provisioning actions for a service component. 
  • Properties, allow you to configure user-defined properties for service components. 
  • Property mappings, allow you to configure the property of a component to obtain its value from the property of another component. 
  • Subscriber Options, allow you to expose service design options in the Offerings Service Portal.
Before enabling and using the Design and Deploy functionality, you should install and enable Operations Orchestration(OO) Containerized capability. For more information, see Install OO on-premises, Install OO on EKS, Install OO on AKS and Enable OO Containerized in Suite Administration.

Following are the basic terminologies used in Design and Deploy

Service Design

Service designs are the recipes for automating the cloud and include reusable service components. Service components and their relationships in a service design define the framework for creating the service. Create, configure, and modify service designs to provide on-demand, automated service delivery.
 

Service component

The service component represents one service design element required to realize a service subscription. It provides a framework to describe the actions and resource offerings required to realize, manage, and retire the service design

Service component template

A service component template is a specialized version of a component type and is used to simplify sequenced design creation. Component templates include customized settings for the properties, lifecycle actions, and resource offerings that provide initial settings for the service design.

Resource offering

A resource offering links the capabilities of providers to the provisioning requirements of service design. 

Resource Providers

Resource providers are management platforms that offer centralized control over the infrastructure and resources used in a cloud computing environment.

Service instances

A subscription originates with a subscription request, which is a request for delivery of cloud services that are initiated by the subscriber (end-user) using a service catalog in the Marketplace Portal. After a subscription request is approved, a service instance is created.

To access DND make sure that you have followed all the steps documented in Deploy DND.

To design a sequenced service

Follow these high-level steps to design a sequenced service:

  1. Based on the needs of your organization, create a plan for resource providers, components, lifecycle actions, and other design elements before you begin implementing your design.
  2. Configure the resource providers and resource offerings to deploy the service. See the topics on Providers and Resource offerings for sequenced designs.
  3. Create component types and templates (see the topics on Create a component type and Create component templates) or use out-of-the-box component types and templates (see the topic on Components for sequenced designs).
  4. Create a service design. See the topic on Create a service design.
  5. Use the Designer to create a hierarchy of service components. See the topics on Service designer and Create a service component.
  6. Associate resource offerings with service components. 
  7. Create lifecycle actions for service components. See the topic on Lifecycle actions for service components.
  8. Create and map properties for service components. See the topics on Service component properties and Property mapping.
  9. Complete the service design (blueprint) and publish the design. This makes the service design eligible for selection as the basis of a service offering in the Offerings area. See the topic on Create a service design.

DND application properties

The DND application properties are available in the database. You can update or get the values of the properties from the database by using APIs. For more information, see DND application properties and DND APIs to get or update application properties.
